strings.Value: "I think perhaps you simply haven't met any truly gallant gentlemen."
"I hope I never see the day that women court men!"
"Why, by inquiring after the wishes of the gallant dame."
"Don't make a fool of their sweetheart."

"... I barely turned around and — bam! I don't know how my shield didn't crumble to pieces from the blow! My arm and shoulder scolded me for two days before I got to a healer. So whenever I hear someone say they'll do without a shield on the battlefield, I always remember that ogre. If I didn't have a shield, I don't know where I would be now."

{n}Valerie shakes her hair and sighs.{/n} "To be honest, intelligent creatures frighten me more than mindless monsters. It's their amazing ability to conceal a rotten core behind a front of politeness. I remember one knight..."

"I met him at one of {g|Brevoy}Brevic{/g} mercenary camps. He noticed me among some others and got it into his head that I had to be... conquered. Like some prize, or an honorary trophy. In two days the whole camp knew I was his intended, and would surely belong to him — just give him time." {n}Valerie grinds her teeth.{/n} "And this wasn't the only smug scoundrel life has thrown at me. Supposedly gallant gentlemen who expect only one thing of a woman — to be obedient. And inarticulate."
{n}Valerie runs her fingers along her armor, removing an invisible grain of dust.{/n} "So, where was I? Anyway, we have to go. Lead us, {name}."

{n}Valerie nods.{/n} "Yes. That's exactly how you feel: disgusted. And should you turn from an idol into a living person and refuse — then at that moment 'gallant sir' sees you as an ungrateful wretch."

{n}Valerie shakes her head and chuckles.{/n} "You should rather be sorry for him. He looked quite pathetic when he realized that I could give him not only a rejection but a proper beating back for the insults!"

{n}Valerie looks up at you with sincere curiosity.{/n} "And why not? Do women have to sit and wait for happiness to fall on them — in the form of a man who happens to like them? Though there are plenty of such women in the world. — I'm sure one of them will become the woman of your choice."
{n}Valerie sizes you up.{/n} "Really? And how, do you think, a truly gallant gentleman would behave?"
{n}Valerie purses her lips.{/n} "More like a spying operation than the approach of an honest person. Although I'm sure many men would agree with you."
{n}Valerie smiles to you and looks down.{/n} "Yes. Yes, that would be a welcome change from the row of smug roosters boasting victories they haven't yet won."

{n}Valerie laughs in response.{/n} "Oh, I see you're from that endangered tribe! It's comforting to know men like you still exist." {n}Valerie pauses, looking at you.{/n} "That's probably why I'm still with you. I mean, in your party!"
